info.title: DynaMed & DynaMedex
info.description: MedsAPI DynaMed and DynaMedex provides endpoints to search and retrieve current and accurate evidence-based content. The documentation on this site covers all supported functionality of the MedsAPI suite of APIs. Any fields or parameters not represented by the documentation are unsupported and subject to change. Additional optional query parameters and fields in the response could be added in the future as a non breaking change. Any other change that could break the contract would be considered in a future version. Version 2 of our endpoints will return the most up to date content features.  If using V2 articles, you must use V2 versions of other endpoints.

refresh_token_expires_in.description: The number of seconds remaining before the refresh token will expire.  The lifespan of refresh tokens is usually larger than Access tokens. The exact duration depends on the type of Refresh Tokens issued. The different types explained below in the document.

developer.email.description: Name of the owener of the token

token_type.description: Always set to be a bearer token

issued_at.description: Epoch time when the token was issued

client_id.description: Client Id that the token can be used by

application_name.description: Id of the application that is registered for this token

expires_in.description: Seconds until this token has expired

refresh_count.description: When this token can be refreshed automatically

status.description: Indicates that the token has been approved

401.description: Unauthorized - This request requires authentication and none was provided.

403.description: Forbidden - The authentication credentials do not have access to this resource.

404.description: Not Found - The server was unable to find a resource matching this request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The server has not implemented the requested HTTP method.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The server cannot return the requested media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server cannot understand the media type in this request.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The client has sent too many requests within the given time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - There was an unexpected error with the server

client_id.description: The client_id to use will be provided by EBSCO

client_secret.description: This will be provided by EBSCO

post.description: The authentication endpoint for getting a token, used in all other DynaMed APIs.

aggregations.description: Get counts of pubTypeId, pubTypeGroup or pubTypePretty

fields.description: Indicates which fields to be returned in the response.

filters.description: The fields that should be used to filter / narrow the search results

initiatedBy.description: Origination of the request, passing this parameter will override the default initiatedBy value for both the response and the transaction logs.

pageSize.description: Number of search term result items to return

posterSize.description: Size(s) of poster to return for videos: small, medium, large, full

imageSize.description: Size(s) of poster to return for videos: small, medium, large, full

_metadata.description: Origination of the request, passing this parameter will override the default initiatedBy value for both the response and the transaction logs.

links.description: List of HATEAOS links: current, prev, next, first, last and pubtype links may be provided

method.description: Indicates if the request was a POST

page.description: A page is pageSize items in the results list. The page number indicates the start of the next set or results.

pageSize.description: Maximum request number of items in a page.

pageToken.description: Must be used for continuing the search when paging

queryLanguage.description: Language used for the query term.

queryUsed.description: The query term that was used by the search engine. This could differ from what was originally entered if (1) the user had a typo, and zero results would be returned and an alternate word was found. (2) If the original language was not English, this would be the English word(s) that map from the queryLanguage

original.description: This will be an object reflectingthe original request

totalPages.description: Page size indicates how many results can be returned in a single response.

articles.description: Number of publications matching the pubType articles

field.description: Indicates how many and what publication types each search match would fall into.

anchor.description: Anchor location in the document

slug.description: Relative location of the matched content

title.description: Tite of the content containing the video

description.description: Description of the content, which might briefly summarize the content
description.example: Carcinoid heart disease refers to cardiac manifestations of advanced carcinoid tumors and carcinoid syndrome.

exactMatch.description: Indicates if the term is exactly matched in the item

mediaType.description: When media is returned, indicates the type

anchor.description: The anchor location of the section.

path.description: This is the hierarchical path to the matching text within the section.

title.description: The title of the matching section.

slug.description: Relative location of the matched item

anchor.description: Anchor location in the document

get.description: [Use - /v2/content/search] Additional Documentation [/search](https://developer.ebsco.com/medical-point-care-apis/dynamed/docs)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Word or phrase to search.

parameters.name: initiatedBy
parameters.description: Origination of the request, passing this parameter will override the default initiatedBy value for both the response and the transaction logs.

parameters.name: queryLanguage
parameters.description: Two letter language to translate the query from.

parameters.name: pubTypeId
parameters.description:
(Use 'filter' param instead) This is either singular or comma separated list. Unique identifier(s) representing the publication types this search query
should return. e.g. 'condition', 'drug', 'Image'. These values are discovered
through the 'medsapi-dynamed/v1/pubtypes' endpoint.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page of results to start from. Each page contains 10 results.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for paginated search result. This value is
used to access other pages within the same search result.

parameters.name: filterType
parameters.description: Type of filter to apply to results

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The fields that should be used to filter/narrow the search results.  Required if filterType is specified.

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: Return secure URLs for media links

parameters.name: imageSize
parameters.description: Size(s) of images to return in image links

parameters.name: posterSize
parameters.description: Size(s) of still image to return for video links

parameters.name: includeToC
parameters.description: Include Table of Contents for each item

initiatedBy.description:
Indicates how the query was initiated. If any match is
found, this will be set to 'typed-in'. If no results were found, this
may be set to 'didyoumean-probe' if it was possible for the search
engine to find something using a typo corrected term. If the caller
is making a paging request, this will be set to 'paging'.

pageToken.description: Must be used for continuing the search when paging

searchTime.description:
How long the search took in ms once received by the search
engine. This does not include network latencies.

totalItems.description:
Total number of items that have matched the query word
or phrase.

queryUsed.description:
The query term that was used by the search engine. This
could differ from what was originally entered if (1) the user had
a typo, and zero results would be returned and an alternate word was
found. (2) If the original language was not English, this would be
the English word(s) that map from the queryLanguage

page.description:
A page is one item in the results list. The page number
indicates the start of the next set or results.

pageSize.description:
Page size indicates how many results can be returned in
a single response.

totalPages.description:
Total pages indicates how many queries would need to be
made to get to the end of the list. The last page not contain a full
page size of results.

field.description:
Indicates how many and what publication types each
search match would fall into.

condition.description: Number of publications matching the pubType condition

drug.description: Number of publications matching the pubType drug

request.description:
Contains all of the query parameters exactly as specified
by the caller.

query.description:
Term(s) that were specified, in the original language
not corrected for typos

filterType.description: Type of filter to appied to results

secure.description: Media links have been returned as secure URLs

imageSize.description: Size(s) of images returned in image links

posterSize.description: Size(s) of still images of videos returned in video links

items.description:
Provide paging links for getting next, previous and related
link information.

post.description: Return answers and references to questions from DynaMedex content

parameters.name: x-eis-id-token
parameters.description: id token

parameters.name: Connection
parameters.description: Keep the connection alive until done

parameters.name: X-Accel-Buffering-Type
parameters.description: Send the responses as they are received

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Do not cache responses

parameters.name: imageSize
parameters.description: Specify small (200w), medium (500w) and large (1000w) image sizes are supported. Also, the full image size is supported and is the default if no image size was specified.

parameters.name: mediaLinksFormat
parameters.description: Returns a secure link in its original size. Options are server or browser (default).

parameters.name: convertSvg
parameters.description: Return images and algorithms that are originally in svg format as png format when true.

query.example: what is the cause of hypercalcemia in a 35 year old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB and abnormal lab values

conversationId.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

messageId.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

query.example: what is the cause of hypercalcemia in a 35 year old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB and abnormal lab values
query.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

question.example: What are the potential causes of hypercalcemia in a 35-year-old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB, and abnormal lab values?
question.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

response.example:
• Hypercalcemia can result from malignancies such as squamous cell carcinoma of the lung, which is associated with hypercalcemia of malignancy. This condition is often caused by the release of parathyroid hormone-related protein (PTHrP) from cancer cells, leading to increased calcium reabsorption in the kidney and stimulation of osteoclast activity, resulting in elevated calcium levels.1,2
  • Granulomatous disorders, including tuberculosis (TB), can also cause hypercalcemia. These conditions may lead to increased production of calcitriol, which stimulates gastrointestinal calcium absorption and osteoclastic activity, further elevating calcium levels.1,2
  • Abnormal lab values such as elevated PTHrP levels, low or normal PTH levels, and elevated vitamin D levels may indicate hypercalcemia of malignancy or other underlying causes such as granulomatous disorders.3,4
response.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

query.description: The primary concept for the question.  This helps to focus the question.
query.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

question.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

answer.example: In infants, the evaluation for congenital heart disease (CHD) involves...

supported.description: Indicates if this query is supported.

answerFound.description: Indicates that the answer has been found.

conceptCount.description: The number of medical concepts covered by the query

createdAt.description: Time when the query was executed

conversationId.description: Identifier to be used for subsequent requests

messageId.description: Reflects the number of queries for this Dyna conversation

content.example: Dyna AI responses are for educational purposes only and should not be solely relied upon for medical practice.

moreContent.example: The presentation of a response does not imply any specific ranking by importance or probability and a response may not include all possibly relevant material. Interpretation and application are subject to the judgment of a healthcare professional. Dyna AI responses are not intended to serve as recommendations for individual patients. Do not enter Protected Health Information (PHI).

references.description: References used to provide the answer

hasNotes.description: Indicates if there are workplace notes in any results. Only can be true if workplace notes exist in Dynamic Health or the reference.

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD) >

slug.description: Slug to the page cited

title.description: Title of the specific section on the page cited in the answer

slug.description: Slug to the page and section

anchor.description: Section to advance to

refIndex.description: Matches to the “1” in the answer

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)

hasNote.description: Indicates if any section has workplace notes. Only can be true if workplace notes exist in Dynamic Health or the reference.

metadata.description: This section is used as a reference in the answer

title.description: Title of the Article used in the answer
title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)

streamComplete.description: Flag to indicate if the streaming response is complete

id.description: ID of the image, which can be used with the media endpoint

publicId.description: Public ID, for those with access to Cloudinary

description.example: (A) Chest radiograph reveals poorly defined bilateral nodular opacities in the superior lung fields. (B) Axial computed tomography image of the chest shows centrilobular ground-glass nodules and heterogeneous attenuation, features suggestive of calcium deposition.

copyright.example: © 2010 Massachusetts Medical Society. All rights reserved. Used with permission.

alt.example: (A) Chest radiograph reveals poorly defined bilateral nodular opacities in the superior lung fields. (B) Axial computed tomography image of the chest shows centrilobular ground-glass nodules and heterogeneous attenuation, features suggestive of calcium deposition.
alt.description: Alternate text to display if the image is not rendered

id.description: ID of the algorithm, which can be used with the media endpoint

publicId.description: Public ID, for those with access to Cloudinary

description.example: Adapted from Pediatr Nephrol. 2018 Sep;33(9):1475-1488, Clin Med. (Lond) 2017 Jun;17(3):270-273, BMJ. 2015 Jun 2;350:h2723. Last reviewed 2025.

alt.example: Adapted from Pediatr Nephrol. 2018 Sep;33(9):1475-1488, Clin Med. (Lond) 2017 Jun;17(3):270-273, BMJ. 2015 Jun 2;350:h2723. Last reviewed 2025.
alt.description: Alternate text to display if the image is not rendered

recommendedQuestions.description: Suggested follow-up questions from Dyna AI related to the original query

hasNotes.description: Indicates if content contains a  workplace note when the request is for Dynamic Health.

enabled.description: Indicates if followup queries may be asked

searchTerm.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

question.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

pageToken.description: Token used for tracking a session

messageId.description: The number of questions related to this query

userIntentTimeInMs.description: Time for the entire answer to be completed

answerFound.description: Indicates if there is an answer

answerNotFound.description: Indicates if there is an answer - this is needed for EBSCO statistics

conceptCount.description: The number of medical concepts covered by the query

disclaimer.description: Indicates whether or not the query intent category triggered a disclaimer that was included with the answer

imageCount.description: Number of images in the response

createdAt.description: Time that the query was executed

get.summary: Get all Dyna AI Conversations for a user
get.description: Gets basic information on all conversations for the specified user. Only returns the top-level (question, query, timestamp) information for the most recent message in the conversation.

parameters.name: x-eis-id-token
parameters.description: id token

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of conversations to return

parameters.name: nextPageToken
parameters.description: Pagination key for retrieving the next set of results

parameters.name: isBookmarked
parameters.description: Filter conversations by bookmark status

get.description: Return a list of updated articles within a given time range

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Return article metadata starting at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Return article metdata ending at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page of items to return

get.description: [use /v2/content/articles] - Return list of updated articles within a given range

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Return article metadata starting at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Return article metdata ending at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page of items to return

parameters.name: pubType
parameters.description: pubType of media resources to fetch

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Return article metadata starting at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Return article metdata ending at this date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items returned per page

parameters.name: nextPageToken

description.example:
The main plot shows survival probability during the first
90 days, and the inset shows survival probability over the full
observational period. Survival analysis was based on cardiac arrests
that occurred between January 1, 2009, and October 2, 2011. Mortality
was observed until December 31, 2011, when the data were censored;
thus, there was follow-up to at least 90 days for each beneficiary.
ALS indicates advanced life support; BLS, basic life support.

content.example: • Subbiah R, Gula LJ, Klein GJ, et al. Workup of the cardiac arrest survivor: for the symposium on sudden cardiac death for progress in cardiovascular diseases. Prog Cardiovasc Dis. 2008 Nov-Dec;51(3):195-203

consensusDetails.description: an array of consensus details for the article

anchor.description: the anchor of this consensus detail

noteContent.example: Content referenced with “Consensus” in Hospitalist Focused Content is supported by a combination of the best available evidence and expert opinion put forth by a panel of Hospitalists.

panelContent.example:
Panel participants:

  • Vijay Duggirala, MD: Clinical Assistant Professor, The Ohio State University College of Nursing; Clinical Assistant Professor, The Ohio State University College of Medicine; Hospitalist, Director of Consult Services and Director of Quality & Patient Safety, Division of Hospital Medicine, The Ohio State Wexner Medical Center; Ohio, United States
  • Dr. Duggirala declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Chi Huang, MD: Executive Medical Director of General Medicine and Hospital Medicine Shared Services, Wake Forest Baptist Health System; Section Chief, Hospital Medicine, Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center; Associate Professor of Internal Medicine, Wake Forest Medical School; North Carolina, United States
  • Dr. Huang declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Richard Rothman, MD: Chair and Physician Advisor, Department of Hospital Medicine, Cleveland Clinic India River Hospital; Florida, United States
  • Dr. Rothman declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Andrés J. Solorza, MD: Assistant Clinical Professor, Tufts University; Chair-Person, Department of Hospital Medicine, Lahey Hospital and Medical Center; Massachusetts, United States
  • Dr. Solorza declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Nestor G. Tarragona, MD, FHM, FACP: Assistant Professor of Medicine, Tufts University School of Medicine; Vice Chairperson, Division of Hospital Medicine, Lahey Hospital and Medical Center; Medical Director for Latin America, Teladoc Health; Massachusetts, United States
  • Dr. Tarragona declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Yoania Quintana-Garcia, MD: Hospitalist, Cleveland Clinic Indian River Hospital; Florida, United States
  • Dr. Quintana-Garcia declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.

slug.description:
Complete slug of the article, e.g., `/condition/zika-virus-infection`.
The complete slug is made of the pubType ID, (`condition`) and the title
(`zika-virus-infection`)

title.description: Title of the article, e.g., `Zika Virus Infection`

anchor.description: anchor of this section

content.example:
Related Summaries

  • Ventricular fibrillation
  • Sudden cardiac death
  • Ventricular tachycardia – approach to the patient
  • Advanced cardiovascular life support (ACLS)
  • Adult basic life support (BLS)
  • Immediate post-cardiac arrest care
  • Therapeutic hypothermia for neuroprotection following cardiac arrest
  • Implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD)
  • ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI)
  • Acute coronary syndromes
  • Coronary artery disease (CAD)

pubType.description: array of pub types for this article

text.example:
initial shockable rhythm, witnessed arrest, monitored arrest,
and arrest during daytime hours each associated with increased in-hospital
or survival within 30 days in patients with in-hospital cardiac
arrest (BMJ 2019 Dec 4)
